name: Mariane
welcomeDialog:
hi I'm Mariane, I take care of octopuses here, well i take care of lots of fish here but my specialization are cephalopods. Squids, nautiluses and OCTOPUSES.
Did you know octopuses have blue blood? humans have haemoglobin in their blood cells but octopuses due to high copper level have haemocyanin instead which makes it bluish.
The reason for this is that haemocyanin wouldn't be efficient for humans but for sea creatures like octopuses it's actually better
because in conditions like low temperatures and high pressures it transports oxygen much faster.
Isn't that so cool?!
Oh sorry...I'm talking to much again right? :)
fishInfo: a looooot of octopus fun facts :)
giftReaction: sudkvbakdvbafbvlcnaifbe OMG THAT'S AN OCTOPUUUUUS. awwwww that's so sweeeet. thank youuuuu
